content:
• Wednesday, September 26, 2012
  • THO

    More on Thor Industries (NYSE:THO): FQ4 matches on the top line and beats on a per share basis....

    More on Thor Industries (NYSE:THO): FQ4 matches on the top line and beats on a per share basis. Net earnings rose 20% Y/Y as its recreational vehicle business saw double-digit sales growth, despite narrower margins. Shares -12% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 PM
  • TXI

    More on Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXI): FQ1 meets top line expectations but misses on the bottom...

    More on Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXI): FQ1 meets top line expectations but misses on the bottom line, despite a bump up in margins. Net losses narrowed as the construction-materials company's cement sales improved 14% as the division's profit climbed 29%. Shares -1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceutical (PPHM) says it received a written notice of default from one of its...

    Peregrine Pharmaceutical (PPHM) says it received a written notice of default from one of its lenders yesterday due to its disclosure of "major" discrepancies in data from its bavituximab drug trial. The lender deemed it a material adverse change under the Loan Agreement, and demanded full payment of all obligations, including the outstanding principal of $15M plus all accrued interest and fees. PPHM says it repaid the lender, and has sufficient capital to fund Q4. Shares -15% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • MITK

    Mitek (MITK -11.6%) closed down sharply after announcing it's suing Israel's Top Image Systems...

    Mitek (MITK -11.6%) closed down sharply after announcing it's suing Israel's Top Image Systems for allegedly infringing 4 patents related to mobile image capture/processing. Mitek is already embroiled in a bitter dispute with ex-customer USAA - there could be worries the company, which only posted Q2 revenue of $3.2M, will see its legal bills get out of hand. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • FUL

    H. B. Fuller (NYSE:FUL): FQ3 EPS of $0.53 in-line. Revenue of $500.5M (+37.9% Y/Y) misses by...

    H. B. Fuller (NYSE:FUL): FQ3 EPS of $0.53 in-line. Revenue of $500.5M (+37.9% Y/Y) misses by $14M. Shares -3.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • EXP

    Eagle Materials (NYSE:EXP) -1.5% AH after announcing a public offering of 3M shares of its...

    Eagle Materials (NYSE:EXP) -1.5% AH after announcing a public offering of 3M shares of its common stock to fund a $446M purchase of two cement plants and certain related assets from Lafarge North America.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (NASDAQ:CPHD) guides Q3 sales lower, saying revenue is expected to be in the range of...

    Cepheid (NASDAQ:CPHD) guides Q3 sales lower, saying revenue is expected to be in the range of $79M to $81M, lower than targeted due to intermittent interruptions in the supply of Xpert cartridge parts. The parts availability is being addressed and Cepheid is working aggressively to ship orders.  However, the company currently expects to exit the quarter with more than $5M in backorders which it expects to be fulfilled by the end of October. Shares -3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • THO

    Thor Industries (NYSE:THO): FQ4 EPS of $0.84 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $888.2M (+15.3% Y/Y)...

    Thor Industries (NYSE:THO): FQ4 EPS of $0.84 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $888.2M (+15.3% Y/Y) misses by $2M. Shares +3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • LNDC

    Landec (NASDAQ:LNDC): FQ1 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $102M (+39% Y/Y) beats by...

    Landec (NASDAQ:LNDC): FQ1 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $102M (+39% Y/Y) beats by $11M. Shares +8.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • PCAR

    Paccar (PCAR -0.7%) finishes the day lower after being downgraded to Neutral at Baird earlier...

    Paccar (PCAR -0.7%) finishes the day lower after being downgraded to Neutral at Baird earlier due to stalling global truck demand and its previously announced production cuts. It also cuts its price target to $39 from $45.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • HOV

    Home builders (XHB -2.5%) have been selling off amid the surprise slight decline in new home...

    Home builders (XHB -2.5%) have been selling off amid the surprise slight decline in new home sales last month. MFR isn't buying into the housing recovery mantra, believing it will be "quite some time" before seeing sustained strength, owing to continued intense competition from a huge overhang of existing homes. HOV -5.6%, SPF -5.3%, PHM -4.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • SAN

    Spain's Banco Santander (SAN -4%) is successful in raising $4B as Mexican subsidiary Grupo...

    Spain's Banco Santander (SAN -4%) is successful in raising $4B as Mexican subsidiary Grupo Financiero Santander (BSMX +7.8%) dually lists in Mexico and the U.S. Analysts say the Mexican unit should see solid demand in the U.S., since it's part of a strong banking franchise plus “indiscriminate demand” via index trackers as it will be represented by all of the respective ETFs.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • HAL

    Halliburton (HAL -2.3%) shares slide as Dahlman Rose lowers its profit forecast, citing a...

    Halliburton (HAL -2.3%) shares slide as Dahlman Rose lowers its profit forecast, citing a sluggish outlook for oil and gas drilling in North America. The firm sees falling prices for U.S. hydraulic fracturing services without relief until Q2 of next year, and further losses are expected from HAL's operations in Iraq's Majnoon field.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +6.5%) has steadily moved higher today, aided by a relatively positive...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +6.5%) has steadily moved higher today, aided by a relatively positive Goldman note. Though reiterating a Neutral and continuing to forecast losses through FY15, Goldman is pleased with RIM's BlackBerry subscriber growth and is lifting its estimates in response. The firm also speaks favorably about new BlackBerry 10 information-access and personalization features. 18% of RIM's float was shorted as of Aug. 31. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 3 Comments
  • CORV

    Cardiome Pharma ([[CRME] +4.2%) trades up on the back of Merck's ([[MRK] +0.5%) announcement...

    Cardiome Pharma ([[CRME] +4.2%) trades up on the back of Merck's ([[MRK] +0.5%) announcement that it will return the global marketing and development rights for both the intravenous and oral formulations for vernakalant to CRME.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM

  • 7 Days Group ([[SVN] +5.5%) says its board of directors has received a proposal letter from...

    7 Days Group ([[SVN] +5.5%) says its board of directors has received a proposal letter from certain existing shareholders, including the Carlyle Group and Sequoia Capital China, to acquire all outstanding shares in a going private proposal at $4.2333 per ordinary share. The company expects the board to form a special committee to consider the proposal.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • LPHI

    Life Partners Holdings (NASDAQ:LPHI) is now soaring +120% after a Texas Judge ruled in its...

    Life Partners Holdings (NASDAQ:LPHI) is now soaring +120% after a Texas Judge ruled in its favor. Texas Attorney General Greg Abbott sued LPHI last month, alleging the company misled investors on the life expectancies of individuals selling their life insurance policies to the company - comparing the firm to a used car dealer who rolls back vehicle odometers to increase its value. The ruling can be appealed but Abbott has not yet said whether he will seek to continue the case.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • ZAGG

    Zagg (ZAGG -6.7%) dips lower again as the iPhone 5 bounce that investors were looking for...

    Zagg (ZAGG -6.7%) dips lower again as the iPhone 5 bounce that investors were looking for doesn't help shares hold the $9 mark. As always, short sellers are part of the story with Zagg, and this week they have increased their bets for a short-term pullback of shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • LPHI

    Midday top 10 gainers: LPHI +112%. CTC +18%. AM-OLD +17%. STSI +15%. KCG +11%. WCBO +11%. CAMP...

    Midday top 10 gainers: LPHI +112%. CTC +18%. AM-OLD +17%. STSI +15%. KCG +11%. WCBO +11%. CAMP +10%. DIAL +10%. SCMP +10%. SVN +8%.
    Top 10 Losers: PATH -27%. BTH -19%. OMN -14%. RMKR -13%. CPRX -13%. TISA -12%. GEVO -12%. MITK -12%. OINK -12%. TSTC -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • OMN

    Omnova Solutions (OMN -14.8%) slides after its FQ3 earnings missed the mark late yesterday. The...

    Omnova Solutions (OMN -14.8%) slides after its FQ3 earnings missed the mark late yesterday. The manufacturer of building materials suffered an 8.5% slump in revenue due to price declines, reduced volumes and adverse currency conditions.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • GENTY

    Gentium (GENT -7.8%) gives back early morning gains plus more after saying the European...

    Gentium (GENT -7.8%) gives back early morning gains plus more after saying the European Medicines Agency's Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use has decided to adopt a second List of Outstanding Issues relating to the company's Marketing Authorization Application for Defibrotide. The drug is used to treat and prevent hepatic veno-occlusive disease in adults and children undergoing haematopoietic stem cell transplantation therapy.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • CACI

    CACI International (CACI -4%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral at SunTrust. The firm says that...

    CACI International (CACI -4%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral at SunTrust. The firm says that channel checks indicate a deteriorating outlook and risk to the seasonally strong September quarter. The company lacks positive catalysts to support any further upside to earnings over the near term, therefore margins are likely to come under pressure.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (EA -1.3%) is hit by a downgrade to Neutral from BofA. The firm notes shares as...

    Electronic Arts (EA -1.3%) is hit by a downgrade to Neutral from BofA. The firm notes shares as up 15% from their July 31 low (better than the S&P's 5%), in spite of concerns about the performance of Medal of Honor Warfighter, which arrives on Oct. 23. It thinks Medal of Honor sales could be hurt by a "very crowded holiday quarter" that will also see refreshes for the Halo, Call of Duty, and Assassin's Creed franchises.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • WMB

    Williams Cos. (WMB -2%)  plans to spend C$500M-C$600M to fund a new liquids extraction...

    Williams Cos. (WMB -2%)  plans to spend C$500M-C$600M to fund a new liquids extraction plant and supporting facilities as part of a new long-term gas processing agreement with an unnamed producer in the Canadian oil sands. WMB says the project will expand its presence in Canadian oil sands gas processing and further reduce emissions associated with oil sands production.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • PAY

    Verifone (PAY -7.3%) trades lower with trader chatter tipping off that the company is a target...

    Verifone (PAY -7.3%) trades lower with trader chatter tipping off that the company is a target of more short selling. Shares hit a 52-week low of $27.38 on heavy volume before edging back higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • WDC

    It's time to take profits on SanDisk (SNDK -3.7%), suggests JMP's Alex Gauna, who's downgrading...

    It's time to take profits on SanDisk (SNDK -3.7%), suggests JMP's Alex Gauna, who's downgrading shares to Market Perform following a 45% run-up from June lows. High expectations, a slowdown in NAND pricing improvements, and iPhone 5 supply constraints could affect shares ahead of SanDisk's Q3 report, Gauna argues. On Friday, Avian urged caution with SanDisk due to stabilizing pricing and soft demand in certain end-markets. NAND rival Micron (MU -3.1%) is also lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG -1.7%) shares are lower despite Goldman Sachs' upgrade following "noteworthy...

    Transocean (RIG -1.7%) shares are lower despite Goldman Sachs' upgrade following "noteworthy underperformance" vs. offshore drilling peers. Although RIG operates one of the oldest fleets in the industry and may continue to face downtime and cost issues, the firm thinks "risk-reward has recently come more into balance" and expects RIG to beat Q3 consensus estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 4 Comments
  • GEVO

    Shares of Gevo (GEVO -13%) take another hit today after UBS cut it to Sell and slashed its price...

    Shares of Gevo (GEVO -13%) take another hit today after UBS cut it to Sell and slashed its price target to $1 from $9, citing its isobutanol production halt and a lack of visibility over the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ -13.5%) is crumbling for the second day in a row in the absence of major...

    OCZ Technology (OCZ -13.5%) is crumbling for the second day in a row in the absence of major news. Shares have made new multi-year lows, and are down 48% since Sep. 4. Since then, the money-losing solid-state drive maker has issued an ugly warning and seen CEO Ryan Peterson resign. Does someone know something about OCZ's Oct. 10 FQ2 report?
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • ASRT

    Depomed ([[DEPO] +1.4%) has filed a suit in a federal court in Washington, D.C., seeking an...

    Depomed ([[DEPO] +1.4%) has filed a suit in a federal court in Washington, D.C., seeking an order to require the FDA to grant market exclusivity for Gralise, it's treatment for post-herpetic neuralgia under the orphan-drug designation. The drug received an orphan drug designation in November 2010, and was approved in January 2011. Since its approval, the FDA has not granted orphan drug exclusivity to Gralise, and DEPO claims it's entitled to exclusivity under the law.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +1.7%) is rallying again today (previous) as investors take kindly to...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +1.7%) is rallying again today (previous) as investors take kindly to BlackBerry subscriber data that wasn't as bad as feared. Observers are quick to point out, however, that subscriber growth is being propped up by low-end BlackBerry Curve sales to emerging markets. Tero Kuittinen warns RIM's current focus on developing high-end BlackBerry 10 models could put these sales at risk, as low-end competition from Samsung, Nokia, and others intensifies.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 10 Comments
  • SPLS

    Shares of Staples (SPLS -3.4%) take another leg down as the company's sweeping reorganization...

    Shares of Staples (SPLS -3.4%) take another leg down as the company's sweeping reorganization plan continues to raise concerns on how much more downside is coming down the line. Peers Office Depot (ODP -3.5%) and OfficeMax (OMX -1.7%) are also in the line of fire of traders.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (FTNT -6.7%) dives on news CFO Ken Goldman is leaving for Yahoo. Goldman was the CFO of...

    Fortinet (FTNT -6.7%) dives on news CFO Ken Goldman is leaving for Yahoo. Goldman was the CFO of several other prominent tech companies before joining Fortinet in '07, and has a sterling reputation in Silicon Valley. Nomura is reiterating a Buy, arguing Fortinet will maintain its top position in the growing UTM security hardware market thanks to sales execution, appealing products, and upcoming refreshes.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • AM-OLD

    American Greetings (AM-OLD +18.9%) soars after the company receives a go-private offer from a...

    American Greetings (AM-OLD +18.9%) soars after the company receives a go-private offer from a group of investors that includes CEO Zev Weiss and COO Jeffrey Weiss. The company says it will form a committee to consider the group's offer to purchase shares at $17.18 a pop.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • GTATQ

    GT Advanced Tech (GTAT -6.1%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy and its target price is cut to $6...

    GT Advanced Tech (GTAT -6.1%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy and its target price is cut to $6 from $9 at Canaccord, which concludes that the sapphire cover glass opportunity is not a near-term possibility despite recent optimism. The move is Apple-driven and Samsung is heading towards more of a plastic-based OLED approach, the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 2 Comments
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter Resources (MHR -4.7%) says it has shut ~400 natural gas wells in Kentucky during...

    Magnum Hunter Resources (MHR -4.7%) says it has shut ~400 natural gas wells in Kentucky during the current quarter due to lower natural gas prices and higher transportation costs, reducing production by 1.7 MMcfe/day. MHR also estimates output of ~9.5 MMcfe/day was curtailed after Appalachian wells were affected by a June storm.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • TEVA

    Specialty pharma firm NuPathe (PATH) drops 32% premarket following last night's announcement...

    Specialty pharma firm NuPathe (PATH) drops 32% premarket following last night's announcement that it's in agreements with new and existing investors for $28M in private placement. The financing plus cost controls should provide the company with funding for "approximately one year," enough time, it hopes, to get approval for its NP101 migraine patch.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • SCMP

    Premarket gainers: SCMP +13%.Losers: PATH -32%. BTH -24%. CPRX -20%. GEVO -12%. FTNT -7%. JBL...

    Premarket gainers: SCMP +13%.
    Losers: PATH -32%. BTH -24%. CPRX -20%. GEVO -12%. FTNT -7%. JBL -6%. GTAT -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharmaceutical Partners (NASDAQ:CPRX) tumbles, -20% premarket, after announcing a delay...

    Catalyst Pharmaceutical Partners (NASDAQ:CPRX) tumbles, -20% premarket, after announcing a delay in top-line results from a study of its vigabatrin phase II(b) trial for cocaine addiction. The Department of Veterans Affairs Cooperative Studies Program won't be able to provide results around end of month as expected, but the company still expects a report "significantly earlier than we had originally anticipated."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • JBL

    Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL) down 5% premarket after an earnings miss last night that contained a...

    Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL) down 5% premarket after an earnings miss last night that contained a weak FQ1 outlook of core earnings of $0.51-$0.62 (vs. $0.67 expected) on revenues of $4.3B-$4.5B (vs. $4.52B). The company did still expect earnings to rise 5-10% in fiscal 2013 and authorized buybacks of up to $100M in shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • BTH

    Blyth (NYSE:BTH) -26.3% premarket after its ViSalus subsidiary pulls its IPO due to uncertain...

    Blyth (NYSE:BTH) -26.3% premarket after its ViSalus subsidiary pulls its IPO due to uncertain market conditions. "ViSalus has achieved net sales growth in excess of 450% in the first half of 2012; however, management believes that current market conditions are not conducive to recognizing this level of achievement," BTH says.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • LPHI

    Life Partners (NASDAQ:LPHI) +12.3% premarket after winning a ruling yesterday by a Texas judge...

    Life Partners (NASDAQ:LPHI) +12.3% premarket after winning a ruling yesterday by a Texas judge that the interests it sells in life insurance policy settlements aren’t securities covered by state law. The Texas AG had alleged LPHI was deceiving buyers about the life expectancies of people insured under the policies.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • JASO

    JA Solar (NASDAQ:JASO) up 3.3% premarket as it starts solar module shipments from bids totaling...

    JA Solar (NASDAQ:JASO) up 3.3% premarket as it starts solar module shipments from bids totaling 90MW with China Power Investment and 70MW with China Guangdong Nuclear Solar Energy.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM
  • BIIB

    Biogen IDEC (NASDAQ:BIIB) and partner Swedish Orphan Biovitrum (OTCPK:BIOVF) see positive...

    Biogen IDEC (NASDAQ:BIIB) and partner Swedish Orphan Biovitrum (OTCPK:BIOVF) see positive top-line results from a study of their clotting factor candidate for patients with hemophilia B. The recombinant Factor IX Fc fusion protein was "generally well tolerated" and offers a more long-lasting treatment than current therapies requiring up to three intravenous injections a week. BIIB +2.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 AM
  • RSH

    Shares of RadioShack (NYSE:RSH) trade 4.2% higher premarket after the company announced the...

    Shares of RadioShack (NYSE:RSH) trade 4.2% higher premarket after the company announced the immediate resignation of its CEO to be replaced on an interim basis by CFO Dorvin Lively. Just to recap a bit, the company has posted two straight quarterly losses and cuts its dividend as shares have nosedived 73% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM | 3 Comments
